weekly_top_story.headline: House Passes Fiscal Year 2026 Spending Bills Including Key Healthcare Extenders
weekly_top_story.summary: The U.S. House approved a bipartisan FY2026 spending package extending critical programs like Medicare telehealth flexibilities, Acute Hospital Care at Home through 2026, and other Medicare provisions, averting disruptions and stabilizing funding for healthcare providers amid ongoing fiscal debates.

stories.headline: House Passes Health Funding Package, Including PBM Reform
stories.summary: Congress passed a long-delayed bipartisan health package with new rules for pharmacy benefit managers (PBMs), aiming to curb prescription drug costs after overcoming delays linked to industry complaints.

stories.headline: Department of Veterans Affairs Unveils $1 Trillion Plan to Expand Community Care
stories.summary: The VA proposed spending $1 trillion over the next decade to restructure community care into a nationwide network managed by third-party administrators, sparking debate on costs and implementation during a House hearing.
